snippet.title: Trailer DBZ Team Training (Pokémon mod)
snippet.description:
This is a fan-made GBA mod, the original game is Pokemon Fire Red. All rights belong to Akira Toriyama, Toei Animation, Game Freak, Nintendo.

I do not distribute any game file or patch because of coyrights issues.
You should be able to find it in other videos or by searching "DBZ Team Training", but I can't help you more than that.

Warning !
Check the save at the start of the game. You need to save normally (not with save states) after beating the league, otherwise you'll be stuck. So, make sure that the save works ! Do not rely on save states. I explained how to do at the bottom of the description.
You will find more information about patching and saving in this FAQ list: http://dragon-ball-z-team-training.wikia.com/wiki/Thread:3263.

The ips patch must be applied to the original game: Pokemon Fire Red 1.0. US version.
Make sure that it's the version 1.0., go to the FAQ list for more information.

Thread (Pokecommunity): http://www.pokecommunity.com/showthread.php?t=356222

Wikia: http://dragon-ball-z-team-training.wikia.com/wiki/Dragon_Ball_Z_Team_Training_Wikia

I'm Z-Max and I've made this game from Pokémon Fire Red. It's a mod in which you can create your own team with the characters of Dragon Ball Z.

The title is basic, I didn't look for a specific title... Actually, I just wanted to have fun by making this game.

Here are the main modifications:
-Pokemons are replaced by "fighters". There are 147 fighters.

-There are 167 attacks including 137 new attacks (techniques from Dbz)
with new animations of course, and 30 old attacks (from Pokémon, like Headbutt for example).

-I added new maps for some cities. I didn't change all the maps, only some of them.

-I've changed some overworld sprites too. (mini-sprites on the maps)

-Many items were added. (capsules, senzu...etc) The list is in the thread.

Maybe this is not the perfect game but I've made it alone. It took me many time to do it, then there can be some defects.

About the save: It's the same problem with the other pokemon games. You have to adjust the settings on VBA.
Go to "options" ; "emulator" ; "save type" and choose Automatic and Flash 128K. Then, put the files (emulator and rom) in the same folder. There must not be a save file (".sav") in the folder before opening the rom.
Then you should be able to save. You can also find tutorials.

If you're on Android: Use the emulator Myboy Free and go to Settings, advanced, cartridge type and choose 128. The save should work like that.
You can also watch this tutorial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zV-KmED_XR8

If you want more information, go to the thread on Pokecommunity, on the wikia managed by PureRage,  or on the facebook page. (links at the top)

Now, just enjoy ;)

Other credits:
The music in this video is a cover of "Fight Theme" by Diego Ariel Miranda. Most character sprites iin the mod are from Bandai games (Supersonic Warriors, Advanded Adventure...), some of them are from DeviantArt (I don't remember the name of authors however...).
